label: This page begins the optional stuff. These questions help us keep presentations relevant - we have a whole spectrum of content in computer and physical security to pull from, and we want to know what will benefit the most people.
These questions concentrate on what experience people have with computers, computer security, and generally breaking (into) things.
We'll try to keep this as fun as possible.

elements.label: Cybersecurity Experience
elements.caption: How much do you know about computer security?

elements.label: Interests
elements.caption: What do you want to learn from the club?
options: How to set up a homelab/personal server
How to develop good, secure software
How to compete in CTF competitions
Electronic entry systems (HID, RFID, CAC cards, biometrics)
Binary exploitation or reverse engineering (finding out how binary programs work)
Car hacking (messing with the CAN bus)
Internet of Things (hack a fridge, IP camera, lightbulb, etc)

elements.label: I would go to the following events:
I am interested in the Collegiate Cybersecurity Competition (C3) Team
elements.caption: Represent UCF in national-level competitions like CCDC, CPTC, and CyberForce. bit.ly/UCF_C3Team

elements.label: Any additional comments?
elements.caption: Anything you want to ask to tell the club leadership? The executives do read this, we promise.
